description: This course focuses on learning modern field and laboratory methods to test ecological hypotheses. Students work on group and individual projects to collect and analyze data and give oral and written presentations on projects. Class periods focus on discussion of primary literature and project results. Class trips include visits to local natural areas. Students attend lecture/discussion plus one four-hour laboratory per week. Also counts toward environmental studies major (natural science emphasis) and mathematical biology concentration. Prerequisite: BIO 261.
name: Field Ecology
notes: This is an integrated lab, discussion and lecture course. Lab, discussion and
lecture times will be defined within the course syllabus.
